column4: I'm trying to find out where amarok keeps its default icon.  Can anyone help me out with this?  It'
It's been a very frustrating 3 days trying to track this thing down...
try this "find /usr | grep -i amarok | grep -i png".. see what kind of hits you get
looks like /usr/share/apps/amarok/icons/ would be a good place to look
I've been through /usr/share/apps/amarok/icons already -- no dice.
what icon are you looking for?
Amarok's main program icon (the one that would sit in the tray)
look here /usr/share/app-install/icons
I've got an amarok icon there.. looks like the one in the menu
I've already replaced that one with the one I want... still no dice :/
or this one /usr/share/icons/hicolor/64x64/apps
or.. wait.. what are you trying to do?
Same thing there... I'm wondering if it's possible for it to somehow be compiled in?

I'm trying to get Avant Window Navigator (awn) to use the icon I want it to use for amarok -- it fails to do this because apparently it's difficult to get awn to respect system-wide icon themes.  Attempts to manually set the icon are reversed the moment the application is launched again...
hmm.. I'm not sure replacing icons all over the place is the best approach.. isn't there anything in awn you can change?
Not according to the developers...
ask the developers where awn finds the icon?
They've said it's very random and depends on a number of "difficult to explain factors".
wow.. I have to remember that for when my students ask weird questions.. "it's very random and depends on a number of difficult to explain factors"
haha, yeah, that really made me go "uhhhh.... doesn't sound like a very good answer."
I have no idea.. you might get some answers in #winehq , it's the official wine support channel
